name: FileBrowser - File Creation, Upload, Listing, and Deletion
description: Verify login, creating new files and folders, uploading files, listing directory contents, renaming, downloading, deleting files, and verifying all changes in the file manager UI
steps: 1. Login - Navigate to http://localhost:8087/ in the browser
2. Verify the login page loads showing the File Browser logo, a username field, a password field, and a Login button
3. Enter 'admin' in the username field and 'admin12345678' in the password field and click the Login button
4. Verify successful login by confirming the file manager dashboard loads showing an empty root directory with the toolbar at the top
5. Click the 'New Folder' button in the toolbar to create a new folder
6. Type 'Test Documents' as the folder name in the prompt and confirm
7. Verify the folder 'Test Documents' appears in the file listing
8. Double-click on the 'Test Documents' folder to navigate into it
9. Verify the breadcrumb navigation shows the path as 'Test Documents' and the directory is empty
10. Click the 'New File' button in the toolbar to create a new text file
11. Type 'notes.txt' as the file name and confirm
12. Verify the built-in text editor opens for the newly created file
13. Type 'This is a test note for QA verification.' into the editor and click the Save button
14. Navigate back to the 'Test Documents' folder using the breadcrumb and verify 'notes.txt' is listed with a non-zero file size
15. Click the 'Upload' button in the toolbar to open the file upload dialog
16. Select a sample file (e.g., a small image or text file) from the local system and upload it
17. Verify the uploaded file appears in the 'Test Documents' folder listing alongside 'notes.txt'
18. Navigate back to the root directory using the breadcrumb
19. Click the 'New File' button, name it 'readme.txt', and confirm
20. Type 'Root level readme file.' in the editor and save it
21. Navigate back to the root directory and verify both 'Test Documents' folder and 'readme.txt' are listed
22. Select the 'readme.txt' file by clicking its checkbox and click the Rename button in the action bar
23. Rename the file to 'project-readme.txt' and confirm
24. Verify the file is now listed as 'project-readme.txt' in the root directory
25. Click on 'project-readme.txt' to open it and verify the content still reads 'Root level readme file.'
26. Navigate back to the root directory, select the 'Test Documents' folder by clicking its checkbox, and click the Delete button
27. Confirm the deletion in the confirmation prompt
28. Verify the 'Test Documents' folder and all its contents (notes.txt and the uploaded file) are removed from the listing
29. Select 'project-readme.txt' by clicking its checkbox and click the Delete button and confirm
30. Verify the root directory is now completely empty with no files or folders listed
31. Increase Font Size - Create a new file named 'fonttest.txt' using the 'New file' button in the toolbar and confirm
32. In the text editor that opens, note the font size label displaying '14px' next to the Increase/Decrease font size buttons
33. Click the 'Increase font size' (+) button once
34. Verify the font size label now displays '15px' and the text in the editor textarea visually becomes larger. Validate by reading the font size label text and confirming it shows '15px'
35. Enable Multi-Select Mode - Click the Close button to close the editor, then navigate back to the root directory
36. Click the 'Select multiple' (check_circle) button in the toolbar
37. Verify a banner appears at the bottom of the page showing the text 'Multiple selection enabled' with a 'Clear' button next to it
38. Select Multiple Files - First create two test files: click 'New file', name it 'file1.txt', confirm, type some text, save, and navigate back to root. Repeat to create 'file2.txt'
39. With multi-select mode still enabled, click on 'file1.txt' and 'file2.txt' to select both files
40. Verify both files are highlighted/selected and the Download button shows a badge with the count '2' matching the number of selected files
41. Clear Multi-Selection - With files selected, click the 'Clear' button in the multi-selection banner at the bottom
42. Verify all files are deselected and no files have the active/selected state. The 'Multiple selection enabled' banner may still remain visible
43. Change Ace Editor Theme - Click the 'Settings' button in the left navigation sidebar to open settings
44. Click 'Profile Settings' in the settings sidebar menu to navigate to /settings/profile
45. In Profile Settings, locate the 'Ace editor theme' dropdown and select 'monokai' from the list of available themes
46. Click the 'Update' button below the profile settings form to save the theme change

47. Navigate back to 'My files', open any text file (e.g., 'file1.txt') and verify the editor's color scheme has changed to the monokai dark theme by checking that the editor element has monokai-related CSS classes applied
48. Toggle Single Click Mode - Click 'Settings' in the sidebar, then click 'Profile Settings'
49. In Profile Settings, check the checkbox labeled 'Use single clicks to open files and directories' and click the 'Update' button to save
50. Navigate back to 'My files' and single-click on a file (e.g., 'file1.txt'). Verify the file opens directly in the editor (the URL changes to /files/file1.txt) instead of just selecting the file
51. Browser Back Button - Navigate to Settings by clicking the 'Settings' button in the sidebar (URL should be /settings/global or /settings/profile)
52. Click 'User Management' in the settings sidebar menu to navigate to /settings/users
53. Click the browser Back button to go to the previous page
54. Verify the URL returns to the previous settings page (e.g., /settings/profile or /settings/global) and the correct page content is displayed
55. Cleanup - Navigate back to 'My files', select all test files (fonttest.txt, file1.txt, file2.txt) and delete them to leave the directory clean
